oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Disaster: Or opportunity to serve
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Spare, Randall
Gardiner, Mark
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: practice management
disaster management
wildfires
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This presentation describes the worst natural disaster in the history of SW Kansas, a prairie wildfire that consumed 800,000 acres of grassland, homes, and livestock. The relief efforts were spectacular, with hay, fencing, cattle, and labor donations pouring in from across America. Veterinarians played a significant role in organizing relief efforts for the stricken community. It was truly an opportunity to serve, and the veterinarians' training and experience with problem solving was a significant asset to the relief effort.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2018; 114-116
